docs.lead_paragraph: The outbreak is an international threat and demands vigorous global action before all of West Africa collapses into chaos.
docs.snippet: The outbreak is an international threat and demands vigorous global action before all of West Africa collapses into chaos.

byline.original: By SILAS KPANAN'AYOUNG SIAKOR and NORA BOWIER

docs.lead_paragraph: A South African woman who was quarantined overnight in Nigeria as a suspected Ebola case has tested negative for the disease and will be allowed to return home, a U.S. disease expert assisting Nigerian health authorities said on Friday.

headline.main: South African Quarantined in Nigeria Tests Negative for Ebola
headline.print_headline: South African Quarantined in Nigeria Tests Negative for Ebola

docs.snippet: A South African woman who was quarantined overnight in Nigeria as a suspected Ebola case has tested negative for the disease and will be allowed to return home, a U.S. disease expert assisting Nigerian health authorities said on Friday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Nigerian health authorities said on Thursday they were holding for Ebola testing a South African national in transit to her country because she was showing potential symptoms of the disease after working in Guinea and Sierra Leone.

headline.main: Nigeria Checking South African National as Suspected Ebola Case
headline.print_headline: Nigeria Checking South African National as Suspected Ebola Case

docs.snippet: Nigerian health authorities said on Thursday they were holding for Ebola testing a South African national in transit to her country because she was showing potential symptoms of the disease after working in Guinea and Sierra Leone.

docs.lead_paragraph: The outbreak is another sign of the health impacts of a warming climate.
docs.snippet: The outbreak is another sign of the health impacts of a warming climate.

docs.lead_paragraph: A surge in Ebola infections in Liberia is driving a spiraling outbreak in West Africa that is increasingly putting health workers at risk as they struggle to treat an overwhelming number of patients.

headline.main: With Surge in Liberia, Ebola Case Toll Above 4,200
headline.print_headline: With Surge in Liberia, Ebola Case Toll Above 4,200

docs.snippet: A surge in Ebola infections in Liberia is driving a spiraling outbreak in West Africa that is increasingly putting health workers at risk as they struggle to treat an overwhelming number of patients.

docs.abstract: Why are patients with advanced dementia so often receiving “medications of questionable benefit”?

docs.lead_paragraph: New monkey studies show that one shot of an experimental Ebola vaccine can trigger fast protection, but the effect waned unless the animals got a booster shot made a different way.

headline.main: Monkey Study: Ebola Vaccine Works, Needs Booster
headline.print_headline: Monkey Study: Ebola Vaccine Works, Needs Booster

docs.snippet: New monkey studies show that one shot of an experimental Ebola vaccine can trigger fast protection, but the effect waned unless the animals got a booster shot made a different way.
